title: Shrimp With Peach 'salsa
summary: The recipe Shrimp With Peach 'salsa could satisfy your Mexican craving in around 45 minutes. This recipe makes 20 servings with 66 calories, 4g of protein, and 0g of fat each. For 52 cents per serving, this recipe covers 4% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have hunt's® tomatoes, onion, peaches in juice, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 36 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 47%. This score is solid. Try Shrimp With Peach 'salsa' For Two, Shrimp with Peach Salsan Over Creamy Polenta, and Coconut Baked Shrimp with Pineapple Peach Salsa for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.

instructions: Cook rice according to package directions.  Meanwhile, spray large skillet with cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat.  Add onion; cook 3 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally.  Add next 3 ingredients; cook 2 to 3 minutes or just until boiling.                Add remaining ingredients; cook 2 to 3 minutes more or just until shrimp turn pink, stirring frequently.  Serve over rice.

steps.step: Cook rice according to package directions.  Meanwhile, spray large skillet with cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat.
Add onion; cook 3 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally.
Add next 3 ingredients; cook 2 to 3 minutes or just until boiling.
Add remaining ingredients; cook 2 to 3 minutes more or just until shrimp turn pink, stirring frequently.
